alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:41AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jo Daviess, northeastern Carroll and southwestern Stephenson Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 641 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Massbach, or 11 miles north of Mount Carroll, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freeport, Stockton, Lanark, Pearl City, Shannon, German Valley, Massbach, Loran, Kent, Hitt, Willow, Stockton Airport, Albertus Airport, Bolton and Elmoville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois.
